title: Rasehta
text:
Rasehta is a village in <a href="Amawan">Amawan</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 14 km from <a href="Raebareli">Raebareli</a>, the district headquarters. As of 2011, its population is 2,756, in 491 households. It has one primary school and no healthcare facilities.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Rasehta as comprising 6 hamlets, with a total population of 1,422 people (711 male and 711 female), in 291 households and 291 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 610 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Rasehta as having a population of 1,753 people, in 319 households, and having an area of 235.54 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were listed as wheat and rice.
